System configuration

Here you can configure system settings.

The pins to drive the LED strips in this firmware are locked. To be able to change them, switch to a firmware using bitbanging!

This firmware uses bitbanging to drive the LED strips. This is unreliable and might lead to crashes.

Position of the hands

You can define a custom start position on the LED strip for the weekday, date and month hands. The time is always fixed to the first 60 LEDs. The 12 'o' clock setting defines which LED is at the 12 o'clock position.

Firmware update

Update the firmware of the clock by selecting an update file and click 'Start update'. After about a minute the clock should be updated.

Version
Reset the clock

This resets all settings. You'll have to reconnect to the WiFi provided by the clock and reconfigure the clock.

Reset the WiFi configuration

This resets the wifi configuration. You'll have to reconnect to the WiFi provided by the clock and reconfigure the WiFi connection.
